techmeme.title: The FTC told a US district judge it is still determining who Amazon's competitors are for its 2023 antitrust lawsuit and the list could include Walmart and eBay (Josh Sisco/Bloomberg)
GSMA Intelligence: ~61 countries, including the US and China, plan to shut down their 2G networks, raising digital exclusion concerns, mainly affecting the poor (Lam Le/Rest of World)
Filing: Elon Musk is set to be questioned under oath on April 3 in an investor lawsuit alleging his Twitter buyout flip-flop was a ruse to lower its stock price (Malathi Nayak/Bloomberg)
A look at India's semiconductor push as it invests $18B in five projects, with combined federal and state subsidies covering approximately 70% of project costs (Manish Singh/India Dispatch)
Jim Sanborn, creator of the Kryptos sculpture at CIA HQ, says he's frustrated with amateurs falsely claiming they cracked the 35-year unsolved code using AI (Steven Levy/Wired)
